HOME AtfjPAIBS.EXPIRING fcAWS OOBTIKUAJICE BILL.$ote by the financial Secretary to the treasury.I airoul&te herewith for the consideration of the Committeeof Home Affairs, the draft of the Sxpirin^ Laws Continuance Bill-(Initialled) S* B.July 30, 1930. [10 & 11 GEO. 5.] Expiring Laws Continuance.DRAFTOF AB I L TO Continue certain Expiring Laws. TXjTHEEBAS the Acts mentioned in the Schedule to this Act A.D. 1920. ' * are, in so far as they are in force and are temporary in their duration, limited to expire, as respects the Acts mentioned in Part I. of that schedule, on the thirty-first day of December 5 nineteen hundred and twenty, and, as respects the Acts men- tioned in Parts II., III., and IV. of that schedule, on the twenty- third day of December nineteen hundred and twenty, the thirty- first day of July nineteen hundred and twenty-one, and the nineteenth day of August nineteen hundred and twenty-one10 respectively, and, as respects the Acts mentioned in Part V. of that schedule, on the thirty-first'day of March nineteen hundred and twenty-one: And whereas it is expedient to provide for the continuance as in this Act mentioned of those Acts, and of the enactments15 amending or affecting the same: Be it therefore enacted by the King's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority "of the same, as follows: 20 1* (1) The Acts mentioned in Parts I., II., III., and IV. of Contiuuauco the Schedule to this Act shall, to the extent specified in column ^bedSe"' three of that schedule, be continued until the trmty-first day of December nineteen hundred and twenty-one, and shall then expire, unless further continued.25 (2) The Acts mentioned in Part V. of the Schedule to this Act shall, to the extent' specified in column three of 215--2 A AJD. 1920. that schedule, be continued until the thirty-first day of March nineteen hundred and twenty-two, and shall then expire, unless further continued. (3) Any unrepealed enactments amending or affecting the enactments continued by this Act shall, in so far as they are 5 temporary in their duration, be continued in like manner, whether they are mentioned in the Schedule to this Act or not.Short title. 2. This Act may be cited as the Expiring Laws Continuance Act, 1920. [10 & 11 GEO. 5.] Expiring Laws Continuance,schedule. A.I). 1920.Section 1.PART I. i.
